prompt: Add a responsive navigation bar to the top of the app, including links for Home, About, and Contact pages, using the existing header component as a base.
Remove the sidebar menu from the dashboard view and replace it with a collapsible accordion layout for better mobile compatibility.
Modify the login form by adding a password visibility toggle icon next to the password field, ensuring it switches between text and password input types.
Insert an image carousel in the product gallery section, supporting swipe gestures and auto-play, integrated with the current grid layout.
Adjust the footer layout to include social media icons aligned to the right, with hover effects, while keeping the copyright text centered.
Add a modal popup for user confirmation on delete actions, triggered by the existing delete button, with customizable title and message.
Reposition the search bar from the header to a sticky position at the top of the results page, with a close button for mobile devices.
Convert the static table in the data view to a sortable, paginated list with filter dropdowns for columns like date and status.
Update the primary color scheme to a dark mode theme, changing background to #121212, text to #ffffff, and accents to #bb86fc, applying it globally with CSS variables.
Increase font sizes across all headings by 20% and body text by 10%, using a sans-serif font like Inter for better readability, while maintaining line-height at 1.5.
Adjust spacing in the card components by adding 16px margins between elements and 8px padding inside, ensuring consistency with the overall grid system.
Apply a gradient background to the hero section, from #667eea to #764ba2, with a subtle overlay for text contrast, and animate the fade-in on page load.
Switch the button styles to rounded corners (border-radius: 8px) with a shadow effect on hover, using the current primary color but with 0.2 opacity transition.
Implement a responsive theme toggle button that switches between light and dark modes, storing the preference in localStorage and updating root CSS classes.
Reduce element sizes on mobile by scaling down images to 100% width with max-height: 300px, and adjust button padding to 12px for touch-friendly interactions.
Customize the loading spinner with a blue theme (#007bff), 4px border width, and 1s rotation speed, replacing the default in all async components.

Here’s what I’m planning: [insert your idea, plan, or strategy]. Act as a critical thinker. Question my assumptions, logic, or blind spots — but don’t rewrite anything. I want to stress-test my own thinking, not get new ideas.
Here’s the core idea I’m working with: [insert your idea]. Help me reframe it through a different lens — like a new audience POV, emotional trigger, or brand positioning angle.
Here’s the situation I’m thinking through: [insert idea or challenge]. Help me uncover the real strategic question underneath this. What should I actually be asking myself?
Something about this feels off, but I can’t explain why: [describe the situation, message, or tactic]. Help me put words to the tension I’m sensing. What might be misaligned or unclear?
Here’s the decision or idea I’m considering: [insert]. Help me think through the second- and third-order consequences — what might happen after the obvious outcomes?
Here’s the plan or situation I’m analyzing: [insert]. What critical factor might I be overlooking — the hidden variable that could completely change the outcome if noticed?
Here’s something that worked (or failed): [describe it]. Help me extract the underlying principle so I can apply it elsewhere.
Here’s my idea, and it feels right to me: [insert idea or insight]. Help me unpack why this might make sense — even if I can’t fully explain it yet.
Here are a few examples or situations I’ve noticed: [describe them]. Help me identify the hidden pattern or principle connecting them.
Here’s my goal: [insert]. Instead of moving forward, walk me backward from the desired result — what would need to be true at each step for this to succeed?
Here’s my app idea: [describe it]. Act as a product strategist. Tell me if it solves a real problem, who would use it, and what early validation steps I should take.
Here’s my app concept: [describe it]. Help me list only the essential features for an MVP — what’s the smallest version that still delivers real value?
Here’s what my app does: [describe it]. Map the ideal user flow from first open to main goal. Where could users drop off or get confused?
Here’s my app’s main function: [describe]. Help me find 3 low-cost ways to attract first users and get feedback before launch.
Here’s what I want my app to do: [describe core functions]. Suggest the simplest and cheapest tech stack (frontend, backend, database, hosting) that fits my needs.
Integrate a real-time chat feature using WebSockets, adding a chat window to the user profile page with message sending and emoji support.
Add user authentication via Firebase, including signup, login, and logout flows, securing the dashboard route to require valid tokens.
Implement drag-and-drop functionality for reordering items in the task list, updating the backend API on drop completion with optimistic updates.
Add export options to the reports page, allowing CSV and PDF downloads of the table data using libraries like PapaParse and jsPDF.
Integrate Google Maps API for location-based search in the e-commerce app, displaying markers and directions from user input.
Enhance the form validation with real-time feedback, adding email regex checks and password strength metering before submission.
Add offline support using Service Workers, caching static assets and showing a fallback UI when the network is unavailable.
Implement push notifications for order updates, using the Web Push API to alert users on new statuses like "shipped" or "delivered".
Identify and fix any console errors in the current code, particularly related to undefined variables in the fetch API calls, and add try-catch blocks around async functions.
Improve input validation in the contact form by checking for empty fields, invalid emails, and file size limits, displaying inline error messages in red.
Add comprehensive error logging to Sentry for all API endpoints, capturing stack traces and user context without exposing sensitive data.
Debug the infinite loop in the state update hook, refactoring it to use useCallback and memoization to prevent unnecessary re-renders.
Enhance error messages for network failures by checking response status codes (e.g., 404 for not found, 500 for server error) and showing user-friendly alerts.
Fix accessibility issues in form submissions by ensuring error states are announced via ARIA-live regions for screen readers.
Add fallback handling for third-party API failures, like image loading errors, by displaying placeholder icons and retry buttons.
Review and resolve any prop type warnings in React components, enforcing PropTypes and default values for optional props.
Optimize image loading by implementing lazy loading with the loading="lazy" attribute and adding WebP format support for faster page speeds.
Reduce bundle size by code-splitting the large vendor chunks, using dynamic imports for heavy components like charts and modals.
Improve search functionality by debouncing the input handler to 300ms, preventing excessive API calls during typing.
Memoize expensive computations in the data processing function, using useMemo to cache results based on input dependencies.
Compress CSS and JS files with minification and tree-shaking, targeting a sub-100KB initial load for the homepage.
Add virtual scrolling to the long list component using react-window, rendering only visible items to handle 1000+ entries smoothly.
Profile and fix memory leaks from event listeners in the modal component, ensuring proper cleanup on unmount.
Enable server-side rendering for the initial page load, pre-rendering static content to improve Time to First Byte (TTFB).
Add ARIA labels to all interactive elements, such as buttons and links, describing their purpose (e.g., aria-label="Close menu") for screen reader users.
Ensure keyboard navigation support by adding focus management with tabIndex and onKeyDown handlers for arrow key controls in the menu.
Improve color contrast ratios to meet WCAG 2.1 AA standards, adjusting text colors against backgrounds (e.g., minimum 4.5:1 for normal text).
Add alt text to all images dynamically based on context, and skip decorative images with empty alt attributes.
Implement skip links at the top of the page for direct navigation to main content, styled to be visible only on focus.
Enhance form elements with proper labeling using <label> and role="textbox" for custom inputs, including error announcements.
Support reduced motion preferences by detecting prefers-reduced-motion media query and disabling animations in the CSS.
Audit and fix landmark roles (e.g., role="main", role="navigation") on page sections for better structure in assistive technologies.
Replace all placeholder text in the about page with actual company description: "We are a leading AI development firm specializing in prompt engineering."
Update product images in the catalog by swapping the current URLs with new high-res versions from /assets/new-products/, maintaining aspect ratios.
Revise the welcome message in the header to: "Discover innovative AI tools for your next project," and translate it to Spanish as a toggle option.
Add dynamic content loading for blog posts, pulling titles and excerpts from a JSON file and rendering them in the feed component.
Update the footer links to point to new privacy policy (/privacy) and terms (/terms), with updated copyright year to 2025.
Replace static testimonials with fetched data from an API, displaying user names, quotes, and avatars in a slider format.
Modify error page content to include a friendly message: "Oops! Page not found. Try searching or return home," with a search bar integration.
Refresh the FAQ section by adding three new questions and answers about AI ethics, data privacy, and integration guides, formatted as accordions.
